text: Antoine Valois-Fortier (born March 13, 1990) is a Canadian former athlete. He is best known as a judoka. ==History== He was the winner of the Canadian National Judo Championship in the -81 kg category in 2010. Valois-Fortier won a bronze medal at the 2012 Summer Olympics in London, defeating Travis Stevens of the United States in the men's 81 kg half-middleweight judo. It was the Canada's first medal in Olympic Judo since 2000 when his coach Nicolas Gill won a silver medal at the 2000 Summer Olympics. On December 2, 2021, Valois- Fortier announced that he was retiring and was going to become a coach for the Canadian national team. ==References== ==Other websites== * Antoine Valois- Fortier at the Judoinside.com *Canadian Olympic team profile Category:1990 births Category:Living people Category:Olympic bronze medalists for Canada Category:Canadian judoka Category:Medalists at the 2012 Summer Olympics Category:Sportspeople from Quebec City
title: Antoine Valois-Fortier
